meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a nauplius.
meanings.sent1: The nauplial stage is an important part of the crustacean life cycle.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the nauplial characteristics of the tiny creature.
meanings.sent3: The nauplial appearance of the alien made it look cute and harmless.
meanings.sent4: Her nauplial smile lit up the room with its innocence.
meanings.sent5: The nauplial colors of the butterfly wings were mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the larval stage of certain crustaceans, characterized by three pairs of appendages and a simple body structure.
meanings.sent1: The nauplial crustaceans scuttled along the ocean floor.
meanings.sent2: The aquarium displayed various nauplial creatures for visitors to observe.
meanings.sent3: The chef created a nauplial dish that looked like a tiny crustacean larva.
meanings.sent4: The nauplial clouds drifted lazily in the sky, resembling tiny larvae.
meanings.sent5: The nauplial movements of the dancers mimicked the graceful motions of crustacean larvae.
